item.title: Reddit Strike Has Started
item.description: - Many subreddits are going dark or read-only on June 12th and after as part of a strike.

item.title: Thousands of subreddits pledge to go dark after the Reddit CEO's recent remarks
item.description: - Over 100 subreddits have gone dark in protest of upcoming API changes that would force many third-party apps to shut down.

item.title: Before he was the Unabomber, Ted Kaczynski was a mind-control test subject
item.description: - Ted Kaczynski, also known as the Unabomber, was a mathematics genius who entered Harvard University at the age of 16 on a scholarship.

item.title: The Dutch government wants automatic permission to target victims of hackers
item.description: - The Dutch government is proposing an addition to its intelligence and security services act that would automatically extend warrants to hacking victims.

item.title: Intel is all-in on backside power delivery
item.description: - Intel showcased its PowerVia interconnect technology, which delivers power through the backside of a chip, leading to a 6% performance gain.

item.title: CS:GO: From Zero to 0-Day
item.description: - Researchers found three critical vulnerabilities in the game Counter-Strike: Global Offensive (CS:GO).

item.title: JPEG XL against AVIF tested on ImageEngine
item.description: - Safari is set to support JPEG XL, raising expectations like the hype that surrounded AVIF, but recent tests suggest that JPEG XL can go one step further by reducing file sizes by an additional 11%, while visual quality is 13% better than AVIF.

item.title: CIA 2010 covert communication websites
item.description: - The CIA used covert communication channel websites in the late 2000s to early 2010s which led to the imprisonment and execution of several assets in Iran and China.

item.title: Mental Liquidity
item.description: - Mental liquidity is the ability to quickly abandon previous beliefs when the world changes or when new information is available.

item.title: One man's 8-bit quest to finish his teenage Commodore 64 RPG
item.description: - Mike Brixius is attempting to finish his Commodore 64 CRPG project from 1984, Digital Dungeon Master, almost 40 years later with the help of his supporters.
